data: NEPH Peritoneal Dialysis Peritonitis Empiric Treatment
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Communication Order
Notify Peritoneal Dialysis clinic of patient treatment for peritonitis
Communication Order
Contact PD Nursing staff to initiate Peritonitis Empiric Treatment
Patient Care
For patients presenting with signs and symptoms of peritonitis (abdominal pain, cloudy dialysate or a dialysate white cell count of more than 100 mega/L with greater than 50% PMNs)
Communication Order
If patient has PD fluid in abdomen, ensure at least 2 hours dwell prior to taking samples
Communication Order
If patient does not have PD fluid in abdomen, instill dialysate and dwell for 2 hours prior to taking sample
Notify Treating Provider Laboratory Results
Results for cell count
Medications
heparin
1000 unit, intraperitoneal, as directed, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
Review with Nephrology prior to ordering antimicrobial medication

Indications for intraperitoneal antibiotic treatment:  - Cloudy dialysate by visual inspection  - PD fluid WBC count 100 mega/L or more, of which 50% or more are neutrophils  - Positive gram stain or C&S
Conditional Order - One Time
If/when If clinical indications are present, then nurse to proceed with antibiotic administration

1) No Allergy to cephalosporins:   ceFAZolin 2 g AND cefTAZidime 2 g intraperitoneal with one exchange   OR  if MRSA/MRSE history:  vancomycin (30 mg/kg to maximum of 3 g; round dose to nearest 250 mg) AND cefTAZidime 2 g intraperitoneal with one exchange    2) Allergy to cephalosporins:  vancomycin (30 mg/kg to a maximum of 3 g; round dose to the nearest 250 mg) intraperitoneal AND tobramycin (1.5 mg/kg to a maximum of 160 mg intraperitoneal with one exchange
Order (vancomycin OR ceFAZolin) and (tobramycin OR cefTAZidime)

If cephalosporin allergic, select [vancomycin and tobramycin]
If MRSA/MRSE history, select [vancomycin and cefTAZidime]
For VCH, select [ceFAZolin and cefTAZidime]
For PHC, select [vancomycin and tobramycin]
None

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
ceFAZolin
2,000 mg, intraperitoneal, qdaily with lunch, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj
2,000 mg, intraperitoneal, qHS, order duration: 3 day, drug form: inj
cefTAZidime

3,000 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj

170 mg, intraperitoneal, once, drug form: inj

0.5 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, qdaily with lunch, order duration: 5 day, drug form: inj
0.5 mg/kg, intraperitoneal, qHS, order duration: 5 day, drug form: inj
fluconazole
100 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 3 day, drug form: tab

Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when Suspect site infection, then nurse to order wound culture
Communication Order
Dialysis fluid should be sent after a dwell time of at least 2 hours. Instill intraperitoneal antibiotics after dialysate fluid specimen collected
Conditional Order - Ongoing
If/when temperature greater than 38 DegC, then order and draw Blood Cultures x 2
